titleStmt.title: T. P. Mitchell to James R. Page
CWG2047

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
T. P. MITCHELL
THO. BARBEE.
Mitchell & Barbee, Bankers,
Danville, Ky., 13th Mch 1865
J. B. Page Esq.
Dear Sir:
I have received your favor of the inst. with stated enclosure. You have credit by

Encls'd find Two Dollars -- I have been Notary Public but a few months, but having notified by you that my time was out I send the two Dollar bill. If you were mistaken return the bill if not please send me the comn I would have attended to it sooner but in the press of
business forgot it presence it can be done now. Resy. T. P. Mitchell

Boyle Co
Notary Public
T. P. Mitchell
apptd
15th Mch/65
